candidate_info.name: Measha Brueggergosman
candidate_info.background: Born in 1977 in Fredericton, New Brunswick, Measha Brueggergosman is a Canadian soprano renowned for her exceptional singing talent. She developed her love for music in her local church choir and pursued formal training in music.
candidate_info.cultural_context: Brueggergosman is recognized for her significant contributions to classical music and has performed on international stages, representing Afro-Canadian heritage.

candidate_info.name: Willie O'Ree
candidate_info.background: William Eldon O'Ree, born on October 15, 1935, in Fredericton, New Brunswick, is a retired professional ice hockey player recognized for breaking the color barrier in the NHL when he played for the Boston Bruins in 1958.
candidate_info.cultural_context: O'Ree is celebrated not only for his skills on the ice but also for his role in paving the way for future minority athletes in professional sports.

candidate_info.name: Abraham Beverley Walker
candidate_info.background: Abraham Beverley Walker, born on August 23, 1851, in Belleisle, New Brunswick, was the first Black lawyer in the province and a significant figure in civil rights activism.
candidate_info.cultural_context: Walker's achievements in law and journalism mark him as a pivotal figure in New Brunswick's Black history.

candidate_info.name: Louis Sterling Lawrence
candidate_info.background: Louis Sterling Lawrence, born in 1927, was an accomplished middleweight boxer from Fredericton who excelled in his sport despite the challenges he faced.
candidate_info.cultural_context: His accomplishments in sports symbolize empowerment and the breaking of barriers for Black athletes.

candidate_info.name: Franklin Henderson
candidate_info.background: Franklin Henderson, born in 1947, is a decorated athlete who made a name for himself in wheelchair sports, winning over 80 medals throughout his career.
candidate_info.cultural_context: His determination and success demonstrate resilience and serve as an inspiration within the community.

candidate_info.name: Lena O'Ree
candidate_info.background: Lena O'Ree, born around 1914 in Saint John, was a civil rights activist and the first Black radio show host in New Brunswick.
candidate_info.cultural_context: Her work in media and community activism helped pave the way for greater representation and rights for Black individuals in New Brunswick.
